p: To further demonstrate the effect of EO on glycolysis, the activities of PK and PFK, key enzymes associated with glycolysis, were measured. As shown in Figure 6, the PK activities for the control, model, and EO groups were 1940.37, 3798.00, and 3129.82 U/mg prot, respectively; the PFK activities for the control, model, and EO groups were 119.57, 149.32, and 122.10 U/mg prot, respectively. Compared to the control group, the activities for PK and PFK increased by 95.74% and 24.88% after treatment with LPS, respectively, whereas the activities for PK and PFK decreased by 17.59% and 18.23% after EO treatment. It suggested that EO could disturb the LPS-induced activation of glycolysis.
